contextId.information: The words "stubborn faces" refers to the way they act on the outside, and the words "heard hearts" refers to the way they think and feel. Together they emphasize that the people of Israel would not change how they lived in order to obey God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"very rebellious" (UDB) or "very stubborn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "wrath" and "fury" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that Yahweh is very angry. AT: "because I will be very angry with you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These are sounds people make when they feel very sad or grieved about something. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "Repent" and "turn way" mean basically the same thing. Together they strengthen the command to stop worshiping idols. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Both of these phrases refer to what the people of Israel have done. AT: "the way they live" or "the things they do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

These two phrases share similar meanings. Yahweh speaks of when people founded the city as if it were the city's birth. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These two phrases share similar meanings. They both refer to her growing and becoming taller. AT: "You matured and grew taller" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words mean the same thing. AT: "completely naked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words mean the same thing. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:16:06|16:7]]. AT: "completely naked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Here the words "behavior" and "practices" mean basically the same thing. AT: "and copied the things that they did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: and copied their behavior and practices

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize how large and strong Pharaoh's army is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: mighty army and assembling of many men for war

contextId.information: The words "poor" and "needy" share similar meanings and emphasize that these are people who cannot help themselves. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words mean the same thing and emphasize that she will be completely naked. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

These phrases both describe her prostitution and emphasize how bad this behavior was. The missing words in the parallel phrase may be added. AT: "your shameful behavior and your promiscuousness will be revealed" or "they will reveal your your shameful behavior and your promiscuousness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: your shameful behavior and your promiscuousness

contextId.information: The word "fury" means basically the same thing as and intensifies the word "anger." AT: "my furious anger" or "my extreme anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "fury" and "anger" mean basically the same thing. Together they emphasize the intensity of his anger. AT: "Because I am extremely angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: In my fury and in my anger

contextId.information: Here "ways" and "deeds" mean basically the same thing. AT: "the things that they have done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "ashamed" and "disgraced" share similar meanings. Together they emphasize the intensity of the shame. AT: "So be very ashamed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

Here "mount up" means "rise up" and expresses that his wrath will increase. The words "wrath" and "anger" mean the same thing and emphasize how intense his anger will be. AT: "my anger will greatly increase" or "I will be very angry with you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: my wrath will mount up in my anger

contextId.information: These refer to the same people. It can be stated as a single phrase. AT: "all your soldiers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two phrases have similar meaning and emphasize the fact this this will really happen. AT: "is surely going to happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two phrases mean the same thing. The Israelites will use the wood from the weapons as kindling for fires. AT: "to start fires" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two phrases mean the same thing and can be combined into a single phrase. AT: "every kind of soldier" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: warrior, and every man of war
